benchmark_details.name: Hierarchical Knowledge Preference Benchmark (HIERPREF)
benchmark_details.overview: This benchmark evaluates the ability of language models to follow a defined hierarchy of knowledge preference among instruction knowledge, contextual knowledge, and parametric knowledge, while synthesizing diverse question-answer pairs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and enhance the ability of LLMs to prioritize knowledge correctly based on user instructions and contextual information.

data.source: Sourced from Wikipedia and Wikidata, synthesized to create diverse question-answer pairs with user assumptions.
data.annotation: Automatically generated and synthesized without human annotation.

methodology.calculation: F1 Score is calculated based on the comparison of predicted answers with the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Scores indicate better adherence to the knowledge preference hierarchy.
methodology.baseline_results: Mistral-v0.3-7B fine-tuned with HIERPREF outperformed other models in question answering tasks.
